bioghist.p: William Edmonds Horner (1793-1853) was Dean of the Medical Faculty and a professor of anatomy at the University of Pennsylvania. He was also curator of the Wistar Museum, appointed by Caspar Wistar in 1818. Horner and Wistar's collections were combined to form the Wistar and Horner Museum. The Wistar and Horner Museum collections were further expanded under the curation of Dr. Joseph Leidy, who acquired animal specimens as well as fossil and anthropological samples. The collections were transferred from the University of Pennsylvania to the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology, established by Isaac Wistar, in 1892.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of volumes and papers related to the Wistar and Horner Museum. Materials include: printed catalogs of the museum's specimens, one with manuscript annotations by Horner; reports on additions to the collection by Joseph Leidy; a manuscript list of additions to the museum's collection (1855); correspondence to Leidy from Caldwell K. Biddle, secretary and treasurer of the University's Board of Trustees, regarding the finances of the museum; receipts for museum purchases and receipts for wages paid to museum staff; museum accounts kept by Horner, and later Leidy (1822-1854); Horner's lists of rules for Demonstrators in the Department of Anatomy; agreements between Leidy and Horner regarding Leidy's position as Horner's private assistant and as the curator of the museum (1845 and 1847); a dissecting class book, 1849-1864, listing students and their home states.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
